HS1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

HS1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

HS1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

HS1_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

RELAY_PIN.Description: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.
RELAY_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RELAY_PIN2.Description: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.
RELAY_PIN2.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RELAY_PIN3.Description: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.
RELAY_PIN3.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RELAY_PIN4.Description: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.
RELAY_PIN4.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

EPM_ENABLE.Description: EPM enable/disable. Note enabling will disable the external LEDs on the APM2

CHUTE_TYPE.DisplayName: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)
CHUTE_TYPE.Description: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)

CHUTE_SERVO_ON.Description: Parachute Servo PWM value when parachute is released

CHUTE_SERVO_OFF.Description: Parachute Servo PWM value when parachute is not released

CHUTE_ALT_MIN.DisplayName: Parachute min altitude in cm above home
CHUTE_ALT_MIN.Description: Parachute min altitude above home. Parachute will not be released below this altitude. 0 to disable alt check.

COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_X.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. On a PX4 or Pixhawk with an external compass the correct value is zero if the compass is correctly oriented. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk, but must be set correctly on an APM2. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option

COMPASS_PRIMARY.Description: If more than one compass is available this selects which compass is the primary.

INS_PRODUCT_ID.Description: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only).

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_MPU6K_FILTER.Description: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

INAV_TC_XY.Description: Time constant for GPS and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases GPS impact on position estimate

INAV_TC_Z.Description: Time constant for baro and accel mixing. Higher TC decreases barometers impact on altitude estimate

WPNAV_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

WPNAV_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

WPNAV_SPEED_UP.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_DN.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

WPNAV_LOIT_SPEED.Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

WPNAV_ACCEL.Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_ACCEL_Z.Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

CIRCLE_RADIUS.Description: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

CIRCLE_RATE.Description: Circle mode's turn rate in deg/sec. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

ATC_RATE_RP_MAX.Description: maximum rotation rate in roll/pitch axis requested by angle controller used in stabilize, loiter, rtl, auto flight modes

ATC_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: maximum rotation rate in roll/pitch axis requested by angle controller used in stabilize, loiter, rtl, auto flight modes

ATC_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

ATC_ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

POSCON_THR_HOVER.Description: The autopilot's estimate of the throttle required to maintain a level hover. Calculated automatically from the pilot's throttle input while in stabilize mode

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_EKF_USE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_USE.Description: This controls whether the NavEKF Kalman filter is used for attitude and position estimation

MNT_MODE.Description: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

MNT_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT_CONTROL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_CONTROL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_CONTROL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
MNT_CONTROL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

MNT2_MODE.Description: Camera or antenna mount operation mode

MNT2_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT2_CONTROL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_CONTROL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_CONTROL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle command from groundstation
MNT2_CONTROL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in MavLink or RC control operation mode

MNT2_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT2_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT2_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT2_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

BATT_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 13. On the PX4 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 2.

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

BATT_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT_AMP_PERVOLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BRD_PWM_COUNT.Description: Number of auxillary PWMs to enable. On PX4v1 only 0 or 2 is valid. On Pixhawk 0, 2, 4 or 6 is valid.

BRD_SER1_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

BRD_SER2_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and PX4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SAFETYENABLE.DisplayName: Enable use of safety arming switch
BRD_SAFETYENABLE.Description: Disabling this option will disable the use of the safety switch on PX4 for arming. Use of the safety switch is highly recommended, so you should leave this option set to 1 except in unusual circumstances.

SPRAY_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

SPRAY_PUMP_RATE.Description: Desired pump speed when travelling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_SPINNER.Description: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

SPRAY_SPEED_MIN.Description: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

SPRAY_PUMP_MIN.Description: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

GND_TEMP.Description: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

GND_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

FENCE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the fence functionality

FENCE_TYPE.Description: Enabled fence types held as bitmask

FENCE_ACTION.Description: What action should be taken when fence is breached

FENCE_ALT_MAX.Description: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

FENCE_RADIUS.Description: Circle fence radius which when breached will cause an RTL

FENCE_MARGIN.Description: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence to avoid a breach

RALLY_TOTAL.Description: Number of rally points currently loaded

RALLY_LIMIT_KM.Description: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

GPSGLITCH_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) gps glitch protection

GPSGLITCH_RADIUS.DisplayName: GPS glitch protection radius within which all new positions are accepted
GPSGLITCH_RADIUS.Description: GPS glitch protection radius within which all new positions are accepted

GPSGLITCH_ACCEL.DisplayName: GPS glitch protection's max vehicle acceleration assumption
GPSGLITCH_ACCEL.Description: GPS glitch protection's max vehicle acceleration assumption

H_ROL_MAX.Description: Maximum roll angle of the swash plate

H_PIT_MAX.Description: Maximum pitch angle of the swash plate

H_COL_MIN.Description: Lowest possible servo position for the swashplate

H_COL_MAX.Description: Highest possible servo position for the swashplate

H_COL_MID.Description: Swash servo position corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Assymetrical blades)

H_TAIL_TYPE.Description: Tail type selection. Simpler yaw controller used if external gyro is selected

H_SWASH_TYPE.Description: Swash Type Setting - either 3-servo CCPM or H1 Mechanical Mixing

H_GYR_GAIN.Description: PWM sent to external gyro on ch7 when tail type is Servo w/ ExtGyro

H_SV_MAN.Description: Pass radio inputs directly to servos for set-up. Do not set this manually!

H_PHANG.Description: Phase angle correction for rotor head. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

H_COLYAW.Description: Feed-forward compensation to automatically add rudder input when collective pitch is increased. Can be positive or negative depending on mechanics.

H_GOV_SETPOINT.Description: PWM passed to the external motor governor when external governor is enabled

H_RSC_MODE.Description: Controls the source of the desired rotor speed, either ch8 or RSC_SETPOINT

H_FLYBAR_MODE.Description: Flybar present or not. Affects attitude controller used during ACRO flight mode

H_LAND_COL_MIN.Description: Minimum collective position while landed or landing

H_RSC_RAMP_TIME.Description: Time in seconds for the output to the main rotor's ESC to reach full speed

H_RSC_RUNUP_TIME.Description: Time in seconds for the main rotor to reach full speed. Must be longer than RSC_RAMP_TIME

H_TAIL_SPEED.DisplayName: Direct Drive VarPitch Tail ESC speed
H_TAIL_SPEED.Description: Direct Drive VarPitch Tail ESC speed. Only used when TailType is DirectDrive VarPitch

SS1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS1_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

SS2_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS2_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS2_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS2_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

SS3_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS3_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS3_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS3_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

SS4_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS4_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS4_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SS4_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

MOT_TCRV_ENABLE.Description: Controls whether a curve is used to linearize the thrust produced by the motors

MOT_TCRV_MIDPCT.Description: Set the pwm position that produces half the maximum thrust of the motors

MOT_TCRV_MAXPCT.Description: Set to the lowest pwm position that produces the maximum thrust of the motors. Most motors produce maximum thrust below the maximum pwm value that they accept.

MOT_SPIN_ARMED.Description: Controls whether motors always spin when armed (must be below THR_MIN)

RCMAP_ROLL.Description: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

RCMAP_PITCH.Description: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

RCMAP_THROTTLE.Description: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended.

RCMAP_YAW.Description: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

EKF_VELNE_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the North and East GPS velocity measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EKF_VELD_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the vertical GPS velocity measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EKF_POSNE_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the GPS horizontal position measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EKF_ALT_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EKF_MAG_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EKF_EAS_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EKF_WIND_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_WIND_PSCALE.DisplayName: Height rate to wind procss noise scaler
EKF_WIND_PSCALE.Description: Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind speed estimation noiser.

EKF_GYRO_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

EKF_ACC_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.
EKF_ACC_PNOISE.Range: 0.05 - 1.0 AP_Float _gpsNEVelVarAccScale; // scale factor applied to NE velocity measurement variance due to Vdot

EKF_GBIAS_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of gyro bias state error estimates. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_ABIAS_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of the vertical acelerometer bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_MAGE_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field bias estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_MAGB_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes compass offset estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_VEL_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the GPS velocity measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

EKF_POS_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the GPS position measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.
EKF_POS_DELAY.User: advancedScale factor applied to horizontal position measurement variance due to manoeuvre acceleration

EKF_GPS_TYPE.Description: This parameter controls use of GPS velocity measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity, 1 = use 2D velocity, 2 = use no velocity

EKF_VEL_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_POS_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_HGT_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_MAG_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_EAS_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_MAG_CAL.Description: EKF_MAG_CAL = 0 enables calibration based on flying speed and altitude and is the default setting for Plane users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 1 enables calibration based on manoeuvre level and is the default setting for Copter and Rover users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 2 prevents magnetometer calibration regardless of flight condition and is recommended if in-flight magnetometer calibration is unreliable.

EKF_GLITCH_ACCEL.Description: This parameter controls the maximum amount of difference in horizontal acceleration between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the GPS position data is rejected. If this value is set too low, then valid GPS data will be regularly discarded, and the position accuracy will degrade. If this parameter is set too high, then large GPS glitches will cause large rapid changes in position.

EKF_GLITCH_RAD.Description: This parameter controls the maximum amount of difference in horizontal position (in m) between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the long term glitch protection logic is activated and an offset is applied to the GPS measurement to compensate. Position steps smaller than this value will be temporarily ignored, but will then be accepted and the filter will move to the new position. Position steps larger than this value will be ignored initially, but the filter will then apply an offset to the GPS position measurement.

MIS_TOTAL.Description: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

MIS_RESTART.DisplayName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode
MIS_RESTART.Description: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)

SYSID_SW_MREV.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

SYSID_SW_TYPE.Description: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the first telemetry port. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the second telemetry port. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

RTL_ALT.Description: The minimum altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

SONAR_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the sonar. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the sonar

SONAR_TYPE.Description: Used to adjust scaling to match the sonar used (only Maxbotix sonars are supported at this time)

SONAR_GAIN.Description: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the copter

FS_BATT_ENABLE.Description: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

FS_BATT_VOLTAGE.Description: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage then the copter will RTL

FS_BATT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the copter will RTL

FS_GPS_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action will be taken if GPS signal is lost for at least 5 seconds

FS_GCS_ENABLE.Description: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds
FS_GCS_ENABLE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:Enabled always RTL,2:Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

GPS_HDOP_GOOD.Description: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

MAG_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

FLOW_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

SUPER_SIMPLE.Description: Bitmask to enable Super Simple mode for some flight modes. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

RTL_ALT_FINAL.Description: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

RSSI_PIN.Description: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is RSSI_RANGE for max rssi, 0V for minimum

WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Description: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL
WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Values: 0:Never change yaw, 1:Face next waypoint, 2:Face next waypoint except RTL, 3:Face along GPS course

RTL_LOIT_TIME.Description: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before begining final descent

LAND_SPEED.Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

PILOT_VELZ_MAX.Description: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

PILOT_ACCEL_Z.Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

THR_MIN.Description: The minimum throttle that will be sent to the motors to keep them spinning

THR_MAX.Description: The maximum throttle that will be sent to the motors. This should normally be left as 1000.

FS_THR_ENABLE.Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel
FS_THR_ENABLE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:Enabled always RTL,2:Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode,3:Enabled always LAND

FS_THR_VALUE.Description: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

TRIM_THROTTLE.Description: The autopilot's estimate of the throttle required to maintain a level hover. Calculated automatically from the pilot's throttle input while in stabilize mode

THR_MID.Description: The throttle output (0 ~ 1000) when throttle stick is in mid position. Used to scale the manual throttle so that the mid throttle stick position is close to the throttle required to hover

FLTMODE1.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

FLTMODE2.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

FLTMODE3.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

FLTMODE4.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

FLTMODE5.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

FLTMODE6.Description: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

SIMPLE.Description: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

LOG_BITMASK.Description: 2 byte bitmap of log types to enable

ESC.Description: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

TUNE.Description: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob
TUNE.Values: 0:None,1:Stab Roll/Pitch kP,4:Rate Roll/Pitch kP,5:Rate Roll/Pitch kI,21:Rate Roll/Pitch kD,3:Stab Yaw kP,6:Rate Yaw kP,26:Rate Yaw kD,14:Altitude Hold kP,7:Throttle Rate kP,34:Throttle Accel kP,35:Throttle Accel kI,36:Throttle Accel kD,42:Loiter Speed,12:Loiter Pos kP,22:Loiter Rate kP,28:Loiter Rate kI,23:Loiter Rate kD,10:WP Speed,25:Acro RollPitch kP,40:Acro Yaw kP,9:Relay On/Off,13:Heli Ext Gyro,17:OF Loiter kP,18:OF Loiter kI,19:OF Loiter kD,30:AHRS Yaw kP,31:AHRS kP,32:INAV_TC,38:Declination,39:Circle Rate,41:Sonar Gain

TUNE_LOW.Description: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

TUNE_HIGH.Description: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

FRAME.Description: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

CH7_OPT.Description: Select which function if performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm
CH7_OPT.Values: 0:Do Nothing, 2:Flip, 3:Simple Mode, 4:RTL, 5:Save Trim, 7:Save WP, 8:Multi Mode, 9:Camera Trigger, 10:Sonar, 11:Fence, 12:ResetToArmedYaw, 13:Super Simple Mode, 14:Acro Trainer, 16:Auto, 17:AutoTune, 18:Land, 19:EPM, 20:EKF, 21:Parachute Enable, 22:Parachute Release, 23:Parachute 3pos, 24:Auto Mission Reset, 25:AttCon Feed Forward, 26:AttCon Accel Limits

CH8_OPT.Description: Select which function if performed when CH8 is above 1800 pwm
CH8_OPT.Values: 0:Do Nothing, 2:Flip, 3:Simple Mode, 4:RTL, 5:Save Trim, 7:Save WP, 8:Multi Mode, 9:Camera Trigger, 10:Sonar, 11:Fence, 12:ResetToArmedYaw, 13:Super Simple Mode, 14:Acro Trainer, 16:Auto, 17:AutoTune, 18:Land, 19:EPM, 20:EKF, 21:Parachute Enable, 22:Parachute Release, 23:Parachute 3pos, 24:Auto Mission Reset, 25:AttCon Feed Forward, 26:AttCon Accel Limits

ARMING_CHECK.Description: Allows enabling or disabling of pre-arming checks of receiver, accelerometer, barometer, compass and GPS
ARMING_CHECK.Values: 0:Disabled, 1:Enabled, -3:Skip Baro, -5:Skip Compass, -9:Skip GPS, -17:Skip INS, -33:Skip Parameters, -65:Skip RC, 127:Skip Voltage

ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

RC_FEEL_RP.Description: RC feel for roll/pitch which controls vehicle response to user input with 0 being extremely soft and 100 being crisp

HYBR_BRAKE_RATE.Description: hybrid flight mode's rotation rate during braking in deg/sec

HYBR_BRAKE_ANGLE.Description: hybrid flight mode's max lean angle during braking in centi-degrees

H_STAB_COL_MIN.Description: Helicopter's minimum collective position while pilot directly controls collective in stabilize mode

H_STAB_COL_MAX.Description: Helicopter's maximum collective position while pilot directly controls collective in stabilize mode

RC_SPEED.Description: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

ACRO_RP_P.DisplayName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
ACRO_RP_P.Description: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

ACRO_YAW_P.Description: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO, Stabilize and SPORT modes. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

ACRO_BAL_ROLL.Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode

ACRO_BAL_PITCH.Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode

ACRO_TRAINER.Description: Type of trainer used in acro mode

RATE_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
RATE_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

RATE_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
RATE_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

RATE_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
RATE_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

RATE_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
RATE_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

RATE_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
RATE_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

RATE_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
RATE_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

RATE_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
RATE_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

RATE_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
RATE_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

RATE_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
RATE_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

RATE_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
RATE_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

RATE_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
RATE_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

RATE_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
RATE_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

LOITER_LAT_P.DisplayName: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain
LOITER_LAT_P.Description: Loiter latitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the latitude direction

LOITER_LAT_I.DisplayName: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain
LOITER_LAT_I.Description: Loiter latitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the latitude direction

LOITER_LAT_IMAX.DisplayName: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum
LOITER_LAT_IMAX.Description: Loiter rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

LOITER_LAT_D.DisplayName: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain
LOITER_LAT_D.Description: Loiter latitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

LOITER_LON_P.DisplayName: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain
LOITER_LON_P.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired speed and actual speed into a lean angle in the longitude direction

LOITER_LON_I.DisplayName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain
LOITER_LON_I.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired speed and actual speed in the longitude direction

LOITER_LON_IMAX.DisplayName: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum
LOITER_LON_IMAX.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the lean angle that the I gain will output

LOITER_LON_D.Description: Loiter longitude rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual speed

THR_RATE_P.Description: Throttle rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

THR_RATE_I.Description: Throttle rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical speed and actual speed

THR_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum
THR_RATE_IMAX.Description: Throttle rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the desired acceleration that the I gain will generate

THR_RATE_D.Description: Throttle rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical speed vs actual speed

THR_ACCEL_P.Description: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

THR_ACCEL_I.Description: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

THR_ACCEL_IMAX.DisplayName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
THR_ACCEL_IMAX.Description: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

THR_ACCEL_D.Description: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

OF_RLL_P.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain
OF_RLL_P.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a roll angle

OF_RLL_I.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain
OF_RLL_I.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently rolling left or right

OF_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum
OF_RLL_IMAX.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll angle that the I term will generate

OF_RLL_D.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain
OF_RLL_D.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller roll axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the roll direction

OF_PIT_P.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain
OF_PIT_P.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis P gain. Converts the position error from the target point to a pitch angle

OF_PIT_I.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain
OF_PIT_I.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain. Corrects long-term position error by more persistently pitching left or right

OF_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum
OF_PIT_IMAX.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pitch angle that the I term will generate

OF_PIT_D.DisplayName: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain
OF_PIT_D.Description: Optical Flow based loiter controller pitch axis D gain. Compensates for short-term change in speed in the pitch direction

STB_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis stabilize controller P gain
STB_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

STB_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain
STB_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain. Corrects for longer-term difference in desired roll angle and actual angle

STB_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis stabilize controller I gain maximum
STB_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum roll rate that the I term will generate

STB_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis stabilize controller P gain
STB_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

STB_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis stabilize controller P gain
STB_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis stabilize (i.e. angle) controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

THR_ALT_P.Description: Altitude controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

HLD_LAT_P.Description: Loiter position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

GND_TEMP.Description: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

GND_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

ARMING_REQUIRE.Description: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately). If 1, require rudder stick or GCS arming before arming motors and send THR_MIN PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. If 2, require rudder stick or GCS arming and send 0 PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. See the ARMING_CHECK_* parameters to see what checks are done before arming. Note, if setting this parameter to 0 a reboot is required to arm the plane. Also note, even with this parameter at 0, if ARMING_CHECK parameter is not also zero the plane may fail to arm throttle at boot due to a pre-arm check failure.
ARMING_REQUIRE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:THR_MIN PWM when disarmed,2:0 PWM when disarmed

ARMING_DIS_RUD.Description: Do not allow arming via the rudder input stick.

ARMING_CHECK.Description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed befor allowing arming. The default is no checks, allowing arming at any time. You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and manual RC control you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72.

RELAY_PIN.Description: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.
RELAY_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RELAY_PIN2.Description: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.
RELAY_PIN2.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RELAY_PIN3.Description: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.
RELAY_PIN3.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RELAY_PIN4.Description: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.
RELAY_PIN4.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,50:Pixhawk FMU AUX1,51:Pixhawk FMU AUX2,52:Pixhawk FMU AUX3,53:Pixhawk FMU AUX4,54:Pixhawk FMU AUX5,55:Pixhawk FMU AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

SONAR_PIN.Description: Analog pin that sonar is connected to. Set this to 0..9 for the APM2 analog pins. Set to 64 on an APM1 for the dedicated 'airspeed' port on the end of the board. Set to 11 on PX4 for the analog 'airspeed' port. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog 'airspeed' port.

SONAR_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sonar reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

SONAR_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance

SONAR_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

SONAR_MIN_CM.Description: minimum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

SONAR_MAX_CM.Description: maximum distance in centimeters that sonar can reliably read

SONAR_ENABLE.Description: set to 1 to enable this sonar

SONAR_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables sonar measurement. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the sonar and set to 0 to disable it. This can be used to ensure that multiple sonars don't interfere with each other.

SONAR_SETTLE_MS.Description: The time in milliseconds that the sonar reading takes to settle. This is only used when a STOP_PIN is specified. It determines how long we have to wait for the sonar to give a reading after we set the STOP_PIN high. For a sonar with a range of around 7m this would need to be around 50 milliseconds to allow for the sonar pulse to travel to the target and back again.

RC1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

RC2_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC2_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC2_REV.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

RLL2SRV_TCONST.Description: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved bank angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

RLL2SRV_P.Description: This is the gain from bank angle to aileron. This gain works the same way as the P term in the old PID (RLL2SRV_P) and can be set to the same value.

RLL2SRV_D.Description: This is the gain from roll rate to aileron. This adjusts the damping of the roll control loop. It has the same effect as RLL2SRV_D in the old PID controller but without the spikes in servo demands. This gain helps to reduce rolling in turbulence. It should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency roll oscillation that could overstress the airframe.

RLL2SRV_I.Description: This is the gain from the integral of bank angle to aileron. It has the same effect as RLL2SRV_I in the old PID controller. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out steady offsets due to an out of trim aircraft.

RLL2SRV_RMAX.Description: This sets the maximum roll rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit. If this value is set too low, then the roll can't keep up with the navigation demands and the plane will start weaving. If it is set too high (or disabled by setting to zero) then ailerons will get large inputs at the start of turns. A limit of 60 degrees/sec is a good default.

RLL2SRV_IMAX.Description: This limits the number of degrees of aileron in centi-degrees over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 centi-degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate unless the aircraft is severely out of trim.

PTCH2SRV_TCONST.Description: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved pitch angle. A value of 0.5 is a good default and will work with nearly all models. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the aircraft can achieve.

PTCH2SRV_P.Description: This is the gain from pitch angle to elevator. This gain works the same way as PTCH2SRV_P in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value.

PTCH2SRV_D.Description: This is the gain from pitch rate to elevator. This adjusts the damping of the pitch control loop. It has the same effect as PTCH2SRV_D in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value, but without the spikes in servo demands. This gain helps to reduce pitching in turbulence. Some airframes such as flying wings that have poor pitch damping can benefit from increasing this gain term. This should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency pitch oscillation that could overstress the airframe.

PTCH2SRV_I.Description: This is the gain applied to the integral of pitch angle. It has the same effect as PTCH2SRV_I in the old PID controller and can be set to the same value. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out constant offsets between demanded and measured pitch angle.

PTCH2SRV_RMAX_UP.Description: This sets the maximum nose up pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

PTCH2SRV_RMAX_DN.Description: This sets the maximum nose down pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

PTCH2SRV_RLL.Description: This is the gain term that is applied to the pitch rate offset calculated as required to keep the nose level during turns. The default value is 1 which will work for all models. Advanced users can use it to correct for height variation in turns. If height is lost initially in turns this can be increased in small increments of 0.05 to compensate. If height is gained initially in turns then it can be decreased.

PTCH2SRV_IMAX.Description: This limits the number of centi-degrees of elevator over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate for most aircraft unless they are severely out of trim or have very limited elevator control effectiveness.

YAW2SRV_SLIP.Description: This is the gain from measured lateral acceleration to demanded yaw rate. It should be set to zero unless active control of sideslip is desired. This will only work effectively if there is enough fuselage side area to generate a measureable lateral acceleration when the model sideslips. Flying wings and most gliders cannot use this term. This term should only be adjusted after the basic yaw damper gain YAW2SRV_DAMP is tuned and the YAW2SRV_INT integrator gain has been set. Set this gain to zero if only yaw damping is required.

YAW2SRV_INT.Description: This is the integral gain from lateral acceleration error. This gain should only be non-zero if active control over sideslip is desired. If active control over sideslip is required then this can be set to 1.0 as a first try.

YAW2SRV_DAMP.Description: This is the gain from yaw rate to rudder. It acts as a damper on yaw motion. If a basic yaw damper is required, this gain term can be incremented, whilst leaving the YAW2SRV_SLIP and YAW2SRV_INT gains at zero. Note that unlike with a standard PID controller, if this damping term is zero then the integrator will also be disabled.

YAW2SRV_RLL.Description: This is the gain term that is applied to the yaw rate offset calculated as required to keep the yaw rate consistent with the turn rate for a coordinated turn. The default value is 1 which will work for all models. Advanced users can use it to correct for any tendency to yaw away from or into the turn once the turn is established. Increase to make the model yaw more initially and decrease to make the model yaw less initially. If values greater than 1.1 or less than 0.9 are required then it normally indicates a problem with the airspeed calibration.

YAW2SRV_IMAX.Description: This limits the number of centi-degrees of rudder over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate for most aircraft unless they are severely out of trim or have very limited rudder control effectiveness.

STEER2SRV_TCONST.Description: This controls the time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved steering angle. A value of 0.75 is a good default and will work with nearly all rovers. Ground steering in aircraft needs a bit smaller time constant, and a value of 0.5 is recommended for best ground handling in fixed wing aircraft. A value of 0.75 means that the controller will try to correct any deviation between the desired and actual steering angle in 0.75 seconds. Advanced users may want to reduce this time to obtain a faster response but there is no point setting a time less than the vehicle can achieve.

STEER2SRV_P.Description: The proportional gain for steering. This should be approximately equal to the diameter of the turning circle of the vehicle at low speed and maximum steering angle

STEER2SRV_I.Description: This is the gain from the integral of steering angle. Increasing this gain causes the controller to trim out steady offsets due to an out of trim vehicle.

STEER2SRV_D.Description: This adjusts the damping of the steering control loop. This gain helps to reduce steering jitter with vibration. It should be increased in 0.01 increments as too high a value can lead to a high frequency steering oscillation that could overstress the vehicle.

STEER2SRV_IMAX.Description: This limits the number of degrees of steering in centi-degrees over which the integrator will operate. At the default setting of 1500 centi-degrees, the integrator will be limited to +- 15 degrees of servo travel. The maximum servo deflection is +- 45 centi-degrees, so the default value represents a 1/3rd of the total control throw which is adequate unless the vehicle is severely out of trim.

STEER2SRV_MINSPD.Description: This is the minimum assumed ground speed in meters/second for steering. Having a minimum speed prevents oscillations when the vehicle first starts moving. The vehicle can still driver slower than this limit, but the steering calculations will be done based on this minimum speed.

COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_X.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. On a PX4 or Pixhawk with an external compass the correct value is zero if the compass is correctly oriented. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk, but must be set correctly on an APM2. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option

COMPASS_PRIMARY.Description: If more than one compass is available this selects which compass is the primary.

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

RCMAP_ROLL.Description: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

RCMAP_PITCH.Description: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

RCMAP_THROTTLE.Description: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended.

RCMAP_YAW.Description: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.

INS_PRODUCT_ID.Description: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only).

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_MPU6K_FILTER.Description: Filter frequency to ask the MPU6000 to apply to samples. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. The default value on ArduPlane, APMrover2 and ArduCopter is 20Hz. This option takes effect on the next reboot or gyro initialisation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complmentary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_EKF_USE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_USE.Description: This controls whether the NavEKF Kalman filter is used for attitude and position estimation

ARSPD_PIN.Description: The analog pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to. Set this to 0..9 for the APM2 analog pins. Set to 64 on an APM1 for the dedicated airspeed port on the end of the board. Set to 11 on PX4 for the analog airspeed port. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port. Set to 65 on the PX4 or Pixhawk for an EagleTree or MEAS I2C airspeed sensor.

ARSPD_AUTOCAL.Description: If this is enabled then the APM will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%

ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the top connector on the sensor needs to be the dynamic pressure. If set to 1 then the bottom connector needs to be the dynamic pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft it receiving excessive pressure on the static port, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

NAVL1_PERIOD.Description: Period in seconds of L1 tracking loop. This needs to be larger for less responsive airframes. The default of 30 is very conservative, and for most RC aircraft will lead to slow and lazy turns. For smaller more agile aircraft a value closer to 20 is appropriate. When tuning, change this value in small increments, as a value that is much too small (say 5 or 10 below the right value) can lead to very radical turns, and a risk of stalling.

NAVL1_DAMPING.Description: Damping ratio for L1 control. Increase this in increments of 0.05 if you are getting overshoot in path tracking. You should not need a value below 0.7 or above 0.85.

TECS_CLMB_MAX.Description: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly.
