EKF_ALT_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EKF_MAG_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EKF_EAS_NOISE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EKF_WIND_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_WIND_PSCALE.DisplayName: Height rate to wind procss noise scaler
EKF_WIND_PSCALE.Description: Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind speed estimation noiser.

EKF_GYRO_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

EKF_ACC_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.
EKF_ACC_PNOISE.Range: 0.05 - 1.0 AP_Float _gpsNEVelVarAccScale; // scale factor applied to NE velocity measurement variance due to Vdot

EKF_GBIAS_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of gyro bias state error estimates. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_ABIAS_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of the vertical acelerometer bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_MAGE_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field bias estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_MAGB_PNOISE.Description: This noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes compass offset estimation faster and noisier.

EKF_VEL_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the GPS velocity measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

EKF_POS_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the GPS position measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.
EKF_POS_DELAY.User: advancedScale factor applied to horizontal position measurement variance due to manoeuvre acceleration

EKF_GPS_TYPE.Description: This parameter controls use of GPS velocity measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity, 1 = use 2D velocity, 2 = use no velocity

EKF_VEL_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_POS_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_HGT_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_MAG_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_EAS_GATE.Description: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EKF_MAG_CAL.Description: EKF_MAG_CAL = 0 enables calibration based on flying speed and altitude and is the default setting for Plane users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 1 enables calibration based on manoeuvre level and is the default setting for Copter and Rover users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 2 prevents magnetometer calibration regardless of flight condition and is recommended if in-flight magnetometer calibration is unreliable.

EKF_GLITCH_ACCEL.Description: This parameter controls the maximum amount of difference in horizontal acceleration between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the GPS position data is rejected. If this value is set too low, then valid GPS data will be regularly discarded, and the position accuracy will degrade. If this parameter is set too high, then large GPS glitches will cause large rapid changes in position.

EKF_GLITCH_RAD.Description: This parameter controls the maximum amount of difference in horizontal position (in m) between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the long term glitch protection logic is activated and an offset is applied to the GPS measurement to compensate. Position steps smaller than this value will be temporarily ignored, but will then be accepted and the filter will move to the new position. Position steps larger than this value will be ignored initially, but the filter will then apply an offset to the GPS position measurement.

MIS_TOTAL.Description: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

MIS_RESTART.DisplayName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode
MIS_RESTART.Description: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)

LOG_BITMASK.Description: Two byte bitmap of log types to enable in dataflash

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

INITIAL_MODE.Description: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver. Usuallly used in combination with when AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN or AUTO_KICKSTART.

RSSI_PIN.Description: This selects an analog pin for the receiver RSSI voltage. It assumes the voltage is 5V for max rssi, 0V for minimum

SYSID_THIS_MAV.Description: ID used in MAVLink protocol to identify this vehicle

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: ID used in MAVLink protocol to identify the controlling ground station

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the first telemetry port. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the second telemetry port. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

SKIP_GYRO_CAL.Description: When enabled this tells the APM to skip the normal gyroscope calibration at startup, and instead use the saved gyro calibration from the last flight. You should only enable this if you are careful to check that your aircraft has good attitude control before flying, as some boards may have significantly different gyro calibration between boots, especially if the temperature changes a lot. If gyro calibration is skipped then APM relies on using the gyro drift detection code to get the right gyro calibration in the few minutes after it boots. This option is mostly useful where the requirement to hold the vehicle still while it is booting is a significant problem.

MAG_ENABLED.Description: This should be set to 1 if a compass is installed

AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN.Description: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.

AUTO_KICKSTART.Description: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

CRUISE_SPEED.DisplayName: Target cruise speed in auto modes
CRUISE_SPEED.Description: The target speed in auto missions.

SPEED_TURN_GAIN.Description: The percentage to reduce the throttle while turning. If this is 100% then the target speed is not reduced while turning. If this is 50% then the target speed is reduced in proportion to the turn rate, with a reduction of 50% when the steering is maximally deflected.

SPEED_TURN_DIST.DisplayName: Distance to turn to start reducing speed
SPEED_TURN_DIST.Description: The distance to the next turn at which the rover reduces its target speed by the SPEED_TURN_GAIN

BRAKING_PERCENT.Description: The maximum reverse throttle braking percentage to apply when cornering

BRAKING_SPEEDERR.DisplayName: Speed error at which to apply braking
BRAKING_SPEEDERR.Description: The amount of overspeed error at which to start applying braking

PIVOT_TURN_ANGLE.Description: Navigation angle threshold in degrees to switch to pivot steering when SKID_STEER_OUT is 1. This allows you to setup a skid steering rover to turn on the spot in auto mode when the angle it needs to turn it greater than this angle. An angle of zero means to disable pivot turning. Note that you will probably also want to set a low value for WP_RADIUS to get neat turns.

CH7_OPTION.Description: What to do use channel 7 for

THR_MIN.Description: The minimum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This is mostly useful for rovers with internal combustion motors, to prevent the motor from cutting out in auto mode.

THR_MAX.Description: The maximum throttle setting to which the autopilot will apply. This can be used to prevent overheating a ESC or motor on an electric rover.

CRUISE_THROTTLE.Description: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

THR_SLEWRATE.Description: maximum percentage change in throttle per second. A setting of 10 means to not change the throttle by more than 10% of the full throttle range in one second. A value of zero means no limit.

SKID_STEER_OUT.Description: Set this to 1 for skid steering controlled rovers (tank track style). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

SKID_STEER_IN.Description: Set this to 1 for skid steering input rovers (tank track style in RC controller). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

FS_ACTION.Description: What to do on a failsafe event

FS_TIMEOUT.Description: How long a failsafe event need to happen for before we trigger the failsafe action

FS_THR_ENABLE.Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel to a low value. This can be used to detect the RC transmitter going out of range. Failsafe will be triggered when the throttle channel goes below the FS_THR_VALUE for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

FS_THR_VALUE.Description: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers.

FS_GCS_ENABLE.Description: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. When enabled the Rover will execute the FS_ACTION when it fails to receive MAVLink heartbeat packets for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

SONAR_TRIGGER_CM.Description: The distance from an obstacle in centimeters at which the sonar triggers a turn to avoid the obstacle

SONAR_TURN_ANGLE.Description: The course deviation in degrees to apply while avoiding an obstacle detected with the sonar. A positive number means to turn right, and a negative angle means to turn left.

SONAR_TURN_TIME.Description: The amount of time in seconds to apply the SONAR_TURN_ANGLE after detecting an obstacle.

SONAR_DEBOUNCE.Description: The number of 50Hz sonar hits needed to trigger an obstacle avoidance event. If you get a lot of false sonar events then raise this number, but if you make it too large then it will cause lag in detecting obstacles, which could cause you go hit the obstacle.

LEARN_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for learning waypoints

MODE_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for driving mode control

MODE1.Description: Driving mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

MODE2.Description: Driving mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

MODE3.Description: Driving mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

MODE4.Description: Driving mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

MODE5.Description: Driving mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

MODE6.Description: Driving mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

WP_RADIUS.Description: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the rover will turn along the next waypoint path.

TURN_MAX_G.Description: The maximum turning acceleration (in units of gravities) that the rover can handle while remaining stable. The navigation code will keep the lateral acceleration below this level to avoid rolling over or slipping the wheels in turns

parameter.name: ctl_bw
parameter.long_desc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameter.name: ctl_dir
parameter.long_desc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameter.name: ctl_gain
parameter.long_desc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased; systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a slower, smoother response.

parameter.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameter.long_desc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameter.name: ctl_start_rate
parameter.long_desc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameter.name: esc_index
parameter.short_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameter.long_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameter.name: id_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status ID

parameter.name: int_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameter.name: int_status
parameter.long_desc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameter.name: mot_i_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameter.name: mot_kv
parameter.short_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameter.long_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameter.name: mot_ls
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameter.name: mot_num_poles
parameter.long_desc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_rs
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_v_accel
parameter.long_desc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameter.name: mot_v_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the motor current limit.

parameter.name: ATT_J11
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia matrix diagonal entry (1, 1)

parameter.name: ATT_J22
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia matrix diagonal entry (2, 2)

parameter.name: ATT_J33
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia matrix diagonal entry (3, 3)

parameter.name: ATT_J_EN
parameter.short_desc: Moment of inertia enabled in estimator
parameter.long_desc: If set to != 0 the moment of inertia will be used in the estimator

parameter.name: ATT_MAG_DECL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is not used in normal operation, as the declination is looked up based on the GPS coordinates of the vehicle.

parameter.name: ATT_MAG_DECL_A
parameter.short_desc: Enable automatic GPS based declination compensation

parameter.name: ATT_EXT_HDG_M
parameter.short_desc: External heading usage mode (from Motion capture/Vision) Set to 1 to use heading estimate from vision. Set to 2 to use heading from motion capture

parameter.name: ATT_ACC_COMP
parameter.short_desc: Enable acceleration compensation based on GPS velocity

parameter.name: ATT_VIBE_THRESH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold (of RMS) to warn about high vibration levels

parameter.name: BAT_V_SCALE_IO
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery voltage sensor on PX4IO

parameter.name: BAT_V_SCALING
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery voltage sensor on FMU v2

parameter.name: BAT_C_SCALING
parameter.short_desc: Scaling factor for battery current sensor

parameter.name: BAT_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty.

parameter.name: BAT_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full.

parameter.name: BAT_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: Voltage drop per cell on 100% load
parameter.long_desc: This implicitely defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio and assumes linearity.

parameter.name: BAT_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of the attached battery.

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameter.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = ACTIVE_LOW, 1 = ACTIVE_HIGH )

parameter.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameter.name: TRIG_MODE
parameter.long_desc: 0 disables the trigger, 1 sets it to enabled on command, 2 always on

parameter.name: TRIG_PINS
parameter.long_desc: Selects which pin is used, ranges from 1 to 6 (AUX1-AUX6)

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_RATE_CTRL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for rate controller output
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 140253 will disable the rate controller uORB publication. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action. --> The IO driver will not do flight termination if requested by the FMU WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_ENGINEFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for engine failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 284953 will disable the engine failure detection. If the aircraft is in engine failure mode the enine failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_GPSFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for GPS failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 240024 will disable the GPS failure detection. If this check is enabled, then the sensor check will fail if the GPS module is missing. It will also check for excessive signal noise on the GPS receiver and warn the user if detected. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_EN
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable actions triggered when the datalink is lost.

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_DL_REG_T
parameter.long_desc: After a data link loss: after this this amount of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameter.name: COM_EF_THROT
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only above this throttle value

parameter.name: COM_EF_C2T
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only below this current value

parameter.name: COM_EF_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time

parameter.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without RC connection the rc lost flag is set to true

parameter.name: COM_HOME_H_T
parameter.long_desc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_HOME_V_T
parameter.long_desc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_AUTOS_PAR
parameter.long_desc: If not equal to zero the commander will automatically save parameters to persistent storage once changed. Default is on, as the interoperability with currently deployed GCS solutions depends on parameters being sticky. Developers can default it to off.

parameter.name: COM_RC_IN_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 0 requires a valid RC transmitter setup. Setting this to 1 disables RC input handling and the associated checks. A value of 2 will generate RC control data from manual input received via MAVLink instead of directly forwarding the manual input data.

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_LAND
parameter.short_desc: Time-out for auto disarm after landing
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time-out period in seconds after which the vehicle will be automatically disarmed in case a landing situation has been detected during this period. A value of zero means that automatic disarming is disabled.

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_T
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should wait at the comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_AH_T
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should wait at the airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_N
parameter.long_desc: After more than this number of data link timeouts the aircraft returns home directly

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CHSK
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the system will skip the comms hold wp on data link loss and will directly fly to airfield home

parameter.name: FW_R_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a roll step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_P_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a pitch step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_PR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the elevator input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_PR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch down up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_RR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the aileron input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameter.name: FW_R_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum roll rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_YR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the rudder input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_Y_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum yaw rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_WR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the wheel steering input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_WR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_WR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_W_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum wheel steering rate the controller will output (in degrees per second). Setting a value of zero disables the limit.

parameter.name: FW_RR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output. Use this to obtain a tigher response of the controller without introducing noise amplification.

parameter.name: FW_PR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_WR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YCO_VMIN
parameter.long_desc: For airspeeds above this value, the yaw rate is calculated for a coordinated turn. Set to a very high value to disable.

parameter.name: FW_YCO_METHOD
parameter.long_desc: The param value sets the method used to calculate the yaw rate 0: open-loop zero lateral acceleration based on kinematic constraints 1: closed-loop: try to reduce lateral acceleration to 0 by measuring the acceleration

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: If the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: The TECS controller tries to fly at this airspeed.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: If the airspeed is above this value, the TECS controller will try to decrease airspeed more aggressively.

parameter.name: FW_RSP_OFF
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the roll setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the roll setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max roll for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max pitch for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.

parameter.name: FW_T_TIME_CONST
parameter.long_desc: This is the time constant of the TECS control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameter.name: FW_T_THRO_CONST
parameter.long_desc: This is the time constant of the TECS throttle control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

parameter.name: FW_T_INTEG_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the integrator gain on the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot.

parameter.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in metres/second square) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameter.name: FW_T_HGT_OMEGA
parameter.long_desc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse vertical acceleration and barometric height to obtain an estimate of height rate and height. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the barometer, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_OMEGA
parameter.long_desc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain an improved airspeed estimate. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the arispeed sensor, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameter.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Note to Glider Pilots - set this parameter to 2.0 (The glider will adjust its pitch angle to maintain airspeed, ignoring changes in height).

parameter.name: FW_T_PTCH_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_LT
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for gps recovery before it goes into flight termination.

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_R
parameter.long_desc: Roll in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_TR
parameter.long_desc: Thrust value which is set during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: GF_ACTION
parameter.long_desc: 0 = none, 1 = warning (default), 2 = loiter, 3 = return to launch, 4 = fight termination

parameter.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: Select which altitude reference should be used 0 = WGS84, 1 = AMSL

parameter.name: GF_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameter.name: GF_COUNT
parameter.long_desc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameter.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Set to > 0 to activate a geofence action if horizontal distance to home exceeds this value.

parameter.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Set to > 0 to activate a geofence action if vertical distance to home exceeds this value.

parameter.name: GMB_USE_MNT
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1, mount mode will be enforced.

parameter.name: GMB_AUX_MNT_CHN
parameter.short_desc: Auxilary switch to set mount operation mode
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable manual mode control. If set to an auxilary switch: Switch off means the gimbal is put into safe/locked position. Switch on means the gimbal can move freely, and landing gear will be retracted if applicable.

parameter.name: FW_L1_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the aircraft its following. A value of 25 meters works for most aircraft. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameter.name: FW_L1_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameter.name: FW_THR_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. Most airframes have a value of 0.5-0.7.

parameter.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimum negative pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximum positive pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_R_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The maximum roll the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For overpowered aircraft, this should be reduced to a value that provides sufficient thrust to climb at the maximum pitch angle PTCH_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For electric aircraft this will normally be set to zero, but can be set to a small non-zero value if a folding prop is fitted to prevent the prop from folding and unfolding repeatedly in-flight or to provide some aerodynamic drag from a turning prop to improve the descent rate. For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set for desired idle rpm.

parameter.name: FW_THR_LND_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This throttle value will be set as throttle limit at FW_LND_TLALT, before arcraft will flare.

parameter.name: FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF
parameter.long_desc: If the altitude error exceeds this parameter, the system will climb out with maximum throttle and minimum airspeed until it is closer than this distance to the desired altitude. Mostly used for takeoff waypoints / modes. Set to zero to disable climbout mode (not recommended).

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand required to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than FW_THR_MAX, then either FW_T_CLMB_MAX should be increased or FW_THR_MAX reduced.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)

parameter.name: FW_LND_TLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing throttle limit altitude (relative landing altitude)
parameter.long_desc: Default of -1.0f lets the system default to applying throttle limiting at 2/3 of the flare altitude.

parameter.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameter.short_desc: Enable or disable usage of terrain estimate during landing
parameter.long_desc: 0: disabled, 1: enabled

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_SCALE
parameter.short_desc: Takeoff and landing airspeed scale factor
parameter.long_desc: Multiplying this factor with the minimum airspeed of the plane gives the target airspeed for takeoff and landing approach.

parameter.name: LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameter.name: LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LNDMC_ROT_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum allowed around each axis allowed in the landed state (degrees per second)

parameter.name: LNDMC_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum actuator output on throttle allowed in the landed state

parameter.name: LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameter.name: LNDFW_VELI_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum velocity integral in flight direction allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_A
parameter.long_desc: LAUN_CAT_A * LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_T
parameter.long_desc: LAUN_CAT_A * LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_MDEL
parameter.long_desc: Delay between starting attitude control and powering up the throttle (giving throttle control to the controller) Before this timespan is up the throttle will be set to LAUN_THR_PRE, set to 0 to deactivate

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_PMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum pitch before the throttle is powered up (during motor delay phase)
parameter.long_desc: This is an extra limit for the maximum pitch which is imposed in the phase before the throttle turns on. This allows to limit the maximum pitch angle during a bungee launch (make the launch less steep).

parameter.name: LAUN_THR_PRE
parameter.long_desc: The throttle is set to this value while the system is waiting for the take-off.

parameter.name: LPE_ACC_XY
parameter.long_desc: Data sheet sqrt(Noise power) = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) std dev = (150*9.8*1e-6)*sqrt(1000 Hz) m/s^2 Since accels sampled at 1000 Hz. should be 0.0464

parameter.name: LPE_ACC_Z
parameter.long_desc: (see Accel x comments)

parameter.name: LPE_BAR_Z
parameter.short_desc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation

parameter.name: LPE_NO_VISION
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker to disable vision input
parameter.long_desc: Set to the appropriate key (328754) to disable vision input.

parameter.name: LPE_PN_P
parameter.short_desc: Position propagation process noise power (variance*sampling rate)

parameter.name: LPE_PN_V
parameter.short_desc: Velocity propagation process noise power (variance*sampling rate)

parameter.name: LPE_PN_B
parameter.short_desc: Accel bias propagation process noise power (variance*sampling rate)

parameter.name: LPE_BETA_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Fault detection threshold, for chi-squared dist
parameter.long_desc: TODO add separate params for 1 dof, 3 dof, and 6 dof beta or false alarm rate in false alarms/hr

parameter.name: MAV_RADIO_ID
parameter.long_desc: When non-zero the MAVLink app will attempt to configure the radio to this ID and re-set the parameter to 0. If the value is negative it will reset the complete radio config to factory defaults.

parameter.name: MAV_USEHILGPS
parameter.short_desc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message even if not in HIL mode
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 incoming HIL GPS messages are parsed.

parameter.name: MAV_FWDEXTSP
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 incoming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode

parameter.name: MAV_TEST_PAR
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is not actively used by the system. Its purpose is to allow testing the parameter interface on the communication level.

parameter.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Even if first waypoint has altitude less then MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT above home position, system will climb to MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT on takeoff, then go to waypoint.

parameter.name: MIS_ONBOARD_EN
parameter.long_desc: When enabled, missions that have been uploaded by the GCS are stored and reloaded after reboot persistently.

parameter.name: MIS_DIST_1WP
parameter.short_desc: Maximal horizontal distance from home to first waypoint
parameter.long_desc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIS_1WP from the current position.

parameter.name: MIS_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: 0: the system will follow a zero order hold altitude setpoint 1: the system will follow a first order hold altitude setpoint values follow the definition in enum mission_altitude_mode

parameter.name: MIS_YAWMODE
parameter.long_desc: 0: Set the yaw heading to the yaw value specified for the destination waypoint. 1: Maintain a yaw heading pointing towards the next waypoint. 2: Maintain a yaw heading that always points to the home location. 3: Maintain a yaw heading that always points away from the home location (ie: back always faces home). The values are defined in the enum mission_altitude_mode

parameter.name: NAV_LOITER_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, loiter, RTL, etc. (fixedwing only).

parameter.name: NAV_ACC_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set.

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_OBC
parameter.short_desc: Set OBC mode for data link loss
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the behaviour on data link loss is set to a mode according to the OBC rules

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_OBC
parameter.short_desc: Set OBC mode for rc loss
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the behaviour on data link loss is set to a mode according to the OBC rules

parameter.name: MP_ROLL_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MP_ROLLRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MP_ROLLRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MP_ROLLRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MP_PITCH_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MP_PITCHRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MP_PITCHRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MP_PITCHRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MP_YAW_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MP_YAWRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MP_YAWRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MP_YAWRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MP_YAW_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for manual yaw control. 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MP_YAWRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for yaw rate, has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameter.name: MC_ROLL_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_PITCH_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for manual yaw control. 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for roll rate, has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for pitch rate, has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for yaw rate, has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. A value of significantly over 60 degrees per second can already lead to mixer saturation.

parameter.name: MC_RATT_TH
parameter.long_desc: Manual input needed in order to override attitude control rate setpoints and instead pass manual stick inputs as rate setpoints

parameter.name: MPP_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust.

parameter.name: MPP_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit max allowed thrust.

parameter.name: MPP_Z_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameter.name: MPP_Z_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPP_Z_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameter.name: MPP_Z_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPP_Z_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL).

parameter.name: MPP_Z_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for altitude control in stabilized modes (ALTCTRL). 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MPP_XY_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameter.name: MPP_XY_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error

parameter.name: MPP_XY_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non-zero value allows to resist wind.

parameter.name: MPP_XY_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again

parameter.name: MPP_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for position stabilized mode (POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPP_XY_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for position control in position control mode (POSCTRL). 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MPP_TILTMAX_AIR
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameter.name: MPP_TILTMAX_LND
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum thrust in auto thrust control
parameter.long_desc: It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum thrust in auto thrust control
parameter.long_desc: Limit max allowed thrust. Setting a value of one can put the system into actuator saturation as no spread between the motors is possible any more. A value of 0.8 - 0.9 is recommended.

parameter.name: MPC_MANTHR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust.

parameter.name: MPC_MANTHR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit max allowed thrust. Setting a value of one can put the system into actuator saturation as no spread between the motors is possible any more. A value of 0.8 - 0.9 is recommended.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_Z_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for altitude control in stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL). 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non-zero value allows to resist wind.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for position stabilized mode (POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_XY_FF
parameter.long_desc: Feed forward weight for position control in position control mode (POSCTRL). 0 will give slow responce and no overshot, 1 - fast responce and big overshot.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_AIR
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_LND
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_XY_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Deadzone of X,Y sticks where position hold is enabled

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_Z_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Deadzone of Z stick where altitude hold is enabled

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_Z
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameter.name: MPC_VELD_LP
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cut freq. for numerical velocity derivative

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizonal acceleration in velocity controlled modes

parameter.name: PWM_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Set the minimum PWM for the MAIN outputs
parameter.long_desc: IMPORTANT: CHANGING THIS PARAMETER REQUIRES A COMPLETE SYSTEM REBOOT IN ORDER TO APPLY THE CHANGES. COMPLETELY POWER-CYCLE THE SYSTEM TO PUT CHANGES INTO EFFECT. Set to 1000 for industry default or 900 to increase servo travel.

parameter.name: PWM_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Set the maximum PWM for the MAIN outputs
parameter.long_desc: IMPORTANT: CHANGING THIS PARAMETER REQUIRES A COMPLETE SYSTEM REBOOT IN ORDER TO APPLY THE CHANGES. COMPLETELY POWER-CYCLE THE SYSTEM TO PUT CHANGES INTO EFFECT. Set to 2000 for industry default or 2100 to increase servo travel.

parameter.name: PWM_DISARMED
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for MAIN outputs
parameter.long_desc: IMPORTANT: CHANGING THIS PARAMETER REQUIRES A COMPLETE SYSTEM REBOOT IN ORDER TO APPLY THE CHANGES. COMPLETELY POWER-CYCLE THE SYSTEM TO PUT CHANGES INTO EFFECT. This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. The main use of this parameter is to silence ESCs when they are disarmed.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Set the minimum PWM for the MAIN outputs
parameter.long_desc: IMPORTANT: CHANGING THIS PARAMETER REQUIRES A COMPLETE SYSTEM REBOOT IN ORDER TO APPLY THE CHANGES. COMPLETELY POWER-CYCLE THE SYSTEM TO PUT CHANGES INTO EFFECT. Set to 1000 for default or 900 to increase servo travel

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Set the maximum PWM for the MAIN outputs
parameter.long_desc: IMPORTANT: CHANGING THIS PARAMETER REQUIRES A COMPLETE SYSTEM REBOOT IN ORDER TO APPLY THE CHANGES. COMPLETELY POWER-CYCLE THE SYSTEM TO PUT CHANGES INTO EFFECT. Set to 2000 for default or 2100 to increase servo travel

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DISARMED
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for AUX outputs
parameter.long_desc: IMPORTANT: CHANGING THIS PARAMETER REQUIRES A COMPLETE SYSTEM REBOOT IN ORDER TO APPLY THE CHANGES. COMPLETELY POWER-CYCLE THE SYSTEM TO PUT CHANGES INTO EFFECT. This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. The main use of this parameter is to silence ESCs when they are disarmed.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV1
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 1
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV2
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 2
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV3
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 3
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV4
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 4
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV5
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 5
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV6
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 6
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV7
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 7
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_MAIN_REV8
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of main output channel 8
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_SBUS_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable S.BUS version 1 output instead of RSSI.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_REV1
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of aux output channel 1
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_REV2
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of aux output channel 2
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_REV3
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of aux output channel 3
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_REV4
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of aux output channel 4
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_REV5
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of aux output channel 5
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_REV6
parameter.short_desc: Invert direction of aux output channel 6
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to invert the channel, 0 for default direction.

parameter.name: BD_GPROPERTIES
parameter.long_desc: This parameter encodes the ground drag coefficient and the corresponding decrease in wind speed from the plane altitude to ground altitude.

parameter.name: BD_TURNRADIUS
parameter.long_desc: The planes known minimal turn radius - use a higher value to make the plane maneuver more distant from the actual drop position. This is to ensure the wings are level during the drop.

parameter.name: BD_PRECISION
parameter.long_desc: If the system is closer than this distance on passing over the drop position, it will release the payload. This is a safeguard to prevent a drop out of the required accuracy.

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_CD
parameter.short_desc: Payload drag coefficient of the dropped object
parameter.long_desc: The drag coefficient (cd) is the typical drag constant for air. It is in general object specific, but the closest primitive shape to the actual object should give good results: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_coefficient

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_MASS
parameter.long_desc: A typical small toy ball: 0.025 kg OBC water bottle: 0.6 kg

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_SURFACE
parameter.long_desc: A typical small toy ball: (0.045 * 0.045) / 4.0 * pi = 0.001590 m^2 OBC water bottle: (0.063 * 0.063) / 4.0 * pi = 0.003117 m^2

parameter.name: PE_VEL_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the velocity estimate from GPS.

parameter.name: PE_POS_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the position estimate from GPS.

parameter.name: PE_HGT_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the height estimate from the barometer.

parameter.name: PE_MAG_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the magnetic field estimate from the magnetometer.

parameter.name: PE_TAS_DELAY_MS
parameter.long_desc: The delay in milliseconds of the airspeed estimate.

parameter.name: PE_GPS_ALT_WGT
parameter.short_desc: GPS vs. barometric altitude update weight
parameter.long_desc: RE-CHECK this.

parameter.name: PE_EAS_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this value will make the filter trust this sensor less and trust other sensors more.

parameter.name: PE_VELNE_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Velocity measurement noise in north-east (horizontal) direction
parameter.long_desc: Generic default: 0.3, multicopters: 0.5, ground vehicles: 0.5

parameter.name: PE_VELD_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic default: 0.3, multicopters: 0.4, ground vehicles: 0.7

parameter.name: PE_POSNE_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.5, multicopters: 0.5, ground vehicles: 0.5

parameter.name: PE_POSD_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 1.25, multicopters: 1.0, ground vehicles: 1.0

parameter.name: PE_MAG_NOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.05, multicopters: 0.05, ground vehicles: 0.05

parameter.name: PE_GYRO_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.015, multicopters: 0.015, ground vehicles: 0.015. This noise controls how much the filter trusts the gyro measurements. Increasing it makes the filter trust the gyro less and other sensors more.

parameter.name: PE_ACC_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.25, multicopters: 0.25, ground vehicles: 0.25. Increasing this value makes the filter trust the accelerometer less and other sensors more.

parameter.name: PE_GBIAS_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 1e-07f, multicopters: 1e-07f, ground vehicles: 1e-07f. Increasing this value will make the gyro bias converge faster but noisier.

parameter.name: PE_ABIAS_PNOISE
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.00001f, multicopters: 0.00001f, ground vehicles: 0.00001f. Increasing this value makes the bias estimation faster and noisier.

parameter.name: PE_MAGE_PNOISE
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer earth frame offsets process noise
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.0001, multicopters: 0.0001, ground vehicles: 0.0001. Increasing this value makes the magnetometer earth bias estimate converge faster but also noisier.

parameter.name: PE_MAGB_PNOISE
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer body frame offsets process noise
parameter.long_desc: Generic defaults: 0.0003, multicopters: 0.0003, ground vehicles: 0.0003. Increasing this value makes the magnetometer body bias estimate converge faster but also noisier.

parameter.name: PE_MAGB_X
parameter.long_desc: The magnetometer bias. This bias is learnt by the filter over time and persists between boots.

parameter.name: PE_MAGB_Y
parameter.long_desc: The magnetometer bias. This bias is learnt by the filter over time and persists between boots.

parameter.name: PE_MAGB_Z
parameter.long_desc: The magnetometer bias. This bias is learnt by the filter over time and persists between boots.

parameter.name: PE_POSDEV_INIT
parameter.long_desc: If the standard deviation of the GPS position estimate is below this threshold in meters, the filter will initialize.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_BARO
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for barometer altitude measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_GPS_P
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS altitude measurements. GPS altitude data is very noisy and should be used only as slow correction for baro offset.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_GPS_V
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS altitude velocity measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_VIS_P
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for vision altitude measurements. vision altitude data is very noisy and should be used only as slow correction for baro offset.

parameter.name: INAV_W_Z_LIDAR
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for lidar measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_GPS_P
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for GPS position
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS position measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_GPS_V
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for GPS velocity
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for GPS velocity measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_VIS_P
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for vision position
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for vision position measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_VIS_V
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for vision velocity
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for vision velocity measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_MOC_P
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for mocap position measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_FLOW
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for optical flow
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for optical flow (velocity) measurements.

parameter.name: INAV_W_XY_RES_V
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight for resetting velocity
parameter.long_desc: When velocity sources lost slowly decrease estimated horizontal velocity with this weight.

parameter.name: INAV_W_GPS_FLOW
parameter.short_desc: XY axis weight factor for GPS when optical flow available
parameter.long_desc: When optical flow data available, multiply GPS weights (for position and velocity) by this factor.

parameter.name: INAV_W_ACC_BIAS
parameter.long_desc: Weight (cutoff frequency) for accelerometer bias estimation. 0 to disable.

parameter.name: INAV_FLOW_K
parameter.long_desc: Factor to convert raw optical flow (in pixels) to radians [rad/px].

parameter.name: INAV_FLOW_Q_MIN
parameter.long_desc: 0 - lowest quality, 1 - best quality.

parameter.name: INAV_LIDAR_FILT
parameter.long_desc: Lidar filter detects spikes on lidar measurements and used to detect new surface level.

parameter.name: INAV_LIDAR_ERR
parameter.short_desc: Sonar maximal error for new surface
parameter.long_desc: If sonar measurement error is larger than this value it skiped (spike) or accepted as new surface level (if offset is stable).

parameter.name: INAV_LAND_T
parameter.long_desc: Vehicle assumed landed if no altitude changes happened during this time on low throttle.

parameter.name: INAV_LAND_DISP
parameter.long_desc: Dispersion threshold for triggering land detector.

parameter.name: INAV_LAND_THR
parameter.long_desc: Value should be lower than minimal hovering thrust. Half of it is good choice.

parameter.name: INAV_DELAY_GPS
parameter.long_desc: GPS delay compensation

parameter.name: INAV_FLOW_DIST_X
parameter.short_desc: Flow module offset (center of rotation) in X direction
parameter.long_desc: Yaw X flow compensation

parameter.name: INAV_FLOW_DIST_Y
parameter.short_desc: Flow module offset (center of rotation) in Y direction
parameter.long_desc: Yaw Y flow compensation

parameter.name: INAV_DISAB_MOCAP
parameter.short_desc: Disable mocap (set 0 if using fake gps)
parameter.long_desc: Disable mocap

parameter.name: CBRK_NO_VISION
parameter.long_desc: Set to the appropriate key (328754) to disable vision input.

parameter.name: INAV_ENABLED
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1, use INAV for position estimation. Else the system uses the combined attitude / position filter framework.

parameter.name: RC1_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum value for RC channel 1

parameter.name: RC1_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value (same as min for throttle)

parameter.name: RC1_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum value for RC channel 1

parameter.name: RC1_REV
parameter.long_desc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameter.name: RC1_DZ
parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.
